wobble.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to move unsteadily from side to side, or make something do this
wobble.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The pile of bricks wobbled and fell.
Tom stopped, wobbling from the weight of his load.
wobble.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to go in a particular direction while moving unsteadily from side to side
wobble.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Cindy wobbled along the street on her bike.
wobble.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to be unsure whether to do something
wobble.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The president appeared to wobble over sending the troops in.
